com.jpacker.evaluators
Interface Evaluator

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractEvaluator, DeleteEvaluator, IntegerEvaluator, StringEvaluator
public interface Evaluator

After expressions have been added to a JPackerParser object and a ReplacementStrategy has been set, each JPackerPattern should have an Evaluator object that'll evaluate a certain match of a pattern expression and return a suitable replacement String. Commonly, after all expressions have been added the the JPackerParser object, a one-line String that contains all expressions is created by the JPackerParser object using the JPackerParser.getJPatterns() method. In the evaluate(Matcher, int) method, the offset integer parameter represents the position in such String that corresponds to a JPackerPattern object.

Method Summary

Gets the JPackerPattern object

Returns:

evaluate

java.lang.String evaluate(java.util.regex.Matcher matcher,
                          int offset)
Evaluates the string matched by the Matcher object and returns a suitable replacement String.

Parameters:
matcher - The Matcher object that contains a match (and its groups)
offset - The offset in the String object returned by the JPackerParser.getJPatterns() method in the JPackerParser object
Returns:
A replacement string (either text or group expressions, i.e.: $1)
See Also:
DefaultReplacementStrategy
